summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense attorney Sigrid McCawley regarding scheduling the trial date in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, with discussion of a witness's preference for an early September trial due to an impending adoption.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office about trial scheduling and witness availability.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, whose trial date is being discussed.

connections.description: McCawley is a defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case.

events.title: Trial Scheduling Discussion
events.description: Email exchange regarding setting the trial date for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, with consideration of a witness's personal circumstances.

keyFacts: The document is email correspondence about scheduling the trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
A witness (name redacted) strongly prefers an early September trial date because she and her husband are adopting a baby due in early November.
Sigrid McCawley of Boies Schiller Flexner LLP is acting as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The communication is between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and Maxwell's defense team.
